adherence.definition: Following medical advice and treatment plans as prescribed
adherence.plainLanguage: Taking your medicine and following your care plan as your doctor told you to

acute.definition: Condition with rapid onset and short duration
acute.plainLanguage: Comes on suddenly and doesn't last long

chronic.plainLanguage: A health problem that lasts a long time

comorbidity.definition: Presence of two or more diseases or conditions
comorbidity.plainLanguage: Having more than one health problem at the same time

contraindication.definition: A condition or factor that makes a treatment inadvisable
contraindication.plainLanguage: A reason why you shouldn't use a certain treatment

dosage.definition: The amount and frequency of medication to take
dosage.plainLanguage: How much medicine to take and how often

side_effect.definition: Unintended effect of medication or treatment
side_effect.plainLanguage: An unwanted change that can happen when you take medicine

monitoring.definition: Regular checking or tracking of health status
monitoring.plainLanguage: Keeping track of how you're doing

prognosis.definition: Expected course and outcome of a condition
prognosis.plainLanguage: What doctors think will happen with your health
